1.name: 12 Angry Men
1.description: A jury holdout attempts to prevent a miscarriage of justice by forcing his colleagues to reconsider the evidence.

2.name: Det sjunde inseglet
2.description: A man seeks answers about life, death, and the existence of God as he plays chess against the Grim Reaper during the Black Plague.

3.name: The Bridge on the River Kwai
3.description: After settling his differences with a Japanese P.O.W. camp commander, a British Colonel co-operates to oversee his men's construction of a railway bridge for their captors, while oblivious to a plan by the Allies to destroy it.

4.name: Paths of Glory
4.description: After refusing to attack an enemy position, a general accuses the soldiers of cowardice and their commanding officer must defend them.

5.name: Witness for the Prosecution
5.description: A veteran British barrister must defend his client in a murder trial that has surprise after surprise.

6.name: Smultronstället
6.description: After living a life marked by coldness, an aging professor is forced to confront the emptiness of his existence.

7.name: The Giant Claw
7.description: Global panic ensues when it is revealed that a mysterious UFO is actually a giant bird that flies at supersonic speed and has no regard for life or architecture.

8.name: The Tin Star
8.description: A cynical former sheriff turned bounty hunter helps a young, recently appointed acting sheriff with his advice, his experience and his gun.

9.name: An Affair to Remember
9.description: A couple falls in love and agrees to meet in six months at the Empire State Building - but will it happen?

10.name: A Face in the Crowd
10.description: An Arkansas drifter becomes an overnight media sensation. As he becomes drunk with fame and power, will he ever be exposed as the fraud he has become?

11.name: Funny Face
11.description: An impromptu fashion shoot at a book store brings about a new fashion model discovery in the shop clerk.

12.name: 3:10 to Yuma
12.description: Broke small-time rancher Dan Evans is hired by the stagecoach line to put big-time captured outlaw leader Ben Wade on the 3:10 train to Yuma but Wade's gang tries to free him.

13.name: Old Yeller
13.description: A teenage boy grows to love a stray yellow dog while helping his mother and younger brother run their Texas homestead while their father is away on a cattle drive. First thought to be good-for-nothing mutt, Old Yeller is soon beloved by all.

14.name: Le notti di Cabiria
14.description: A waifish prostitute wanders the streets of Rome looking for true love but finds only heartbreak.

15.name: Heaven Knows, Mr. Allison
15.description: A marine and a nun form an unlikely friendship. The marine is shipwrecked on a Pacific island and the nun has been left behind there; they find comfort in one another as the two wait out the war.

16.name: Forty Guns
16.description: Showdown in Arizona between the Bonnell brothers, U.S.Marshals, and Jessica Drummond, the iron-fist rancher who controls the territory.

17.name: The Invisible Boy
17.description: A ten-year-old boy and Robby the Robot team up to prevent a Super Computer from controlling the Earth from a satellite.

18.name: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
18.description: Union Army deserter, Lt. Hewitt, trains a rag tag band of all-female homesteaders to defend themselves against a Comanche tribe on the warpath.

19.name: Kumonosu-jô
19.description: A war-hardened general, egged on by his ambitious wife, works to fulfill a prophecy that he would become lord of Spider's Web Castle.

20.name: Operation Mad Ball
20.description: In post-WW2 France, U.S. Army hospital private Hogan and Captain Lock try to outwit one another on issues such as wooing pretty nurses, accounting for missing medical supplies, organizing unauthorized dances and influencing their C.O.

21.name: Sweet Smell of Success
21.description: Powerful but unethical Broadway columnist J.J. Hunsecker coerces unscrupulous press agent Sidney Falco into breaking up his sister's romance with a jazz musician.

22.name: Legend of the Lost
22.description: American ne'er-do-well Joe January is hired to take Paul Bonnard on an expedition into the desert in search of treasure.

23.name: Gunfight at the O.K. Corral
23.description: Lawman Wyatt Earp and outlaw Doc Holliday form an unlikely alliance which culminates in their participation in the legendary Gunfight at the O.K. Corral.

24.name: Night of the Demon
24.description: American professor John Holden arrives in London for a parapsychology conference, only to find himself investigating the mysterious actions of Devil-worshiper Julian Karswell.

25.name: Sayonara
25.description: A US Air Force major in Kobe confronts his own opposition to marriages between American servicemen and Japanese women when he falls for a beautiful performer.

26.name: The Three Faces of Eve
26.description: A doctor treats a woman suffering from Multiple Personality Disorder.

27.name: Love in the Afternoon
27.description: A middle-aged playboy becomes fascinated by the daughter of a private detective who has been hired to entrap him with the wife of a client.

28.name: 20 Million Miles to Earth
28.description: The first U.S. spaceship to Venus crash-lands off the coast of Sicily on its return trip. A dangerous, lizard-like creature comes with it and quickly grows gigantic.

29.name: The Prince and the Showgirl
29.description: An American showgirl becomes entangled in political intrigue when the Prince Regent of a foreign country attempts to seduce her.

30.name: The Scamp
30.description: Tod is a motherless boy, who is mistreated by his violent father. He eventually finds happiness with kindly foster parents.

31.name: Will Success Spoil Rock Hunter?
31.description: To save his career, a writer for television advertising wants a famous actress to endorse a lipstick. In return, he has to pretend to be her new lover.

32.name: The Curse of Frankenstein
32.description: Victor Frankenstein builds a creature and brings it to life, but it behaves not as he intended.

33.name: Letyat zhuravli
33.description: Veronica plans a rendezvous with her lover, Boris, at the bank of river, only for him to be drafted into World War II shortly thereafter.

34.name: The Incredible Shrinking Man
34.description: When Scott Carey begins to shrink because of exposure to a combination of radiation and insecticide, medical science is powerless to help him.

35.name: Desk Set
35.description: Two extremely strong personalities clash over the computerization of a television network's research department.

36.name: Peyton Place
36.description: A peaceful New England town hides secrets and scandals.

37.name: The Enemy Below
37.description: During World War II, an American destroyer meets a German U-Boat. Both captains are experts, and so begins a deadly game of cat-and-mouse.

38.name: Boy on a Dolphin
38.description: A woman finds a treasure and is torn between two men: one who wants to sell it and one who wants to gift it to Greece.

39.name: Raintree County
39.description: A student falls in love with a Southern belle, but their relationship is complicated by her troubled past and the onset of the Civil War.

40.name: Fortune Is a Woman
40.description: An insurance investigator runs into an ex-girlfriend, who is still as beautiful as he remembered her, but is now married. He soon finds himself involved in arson, blackmail, and murder.

41.name: Time Without Pity
41.description: The day before a young man is to be executed for killing his girlfriend, his alcoholic father shows up to try to prove his innocence.

42.name: Jailhouse Rock
42.description: After serving time for manslaughter, young Vince Everett becomes a teenage rock star.

43.name: Pal Joey
43.description: Joey Evans is charming, handsome, funny, talented, and a first class, A-number-one heel. When Joey meets the former chorus girl ("She used to be 'Vera...with the Vanishing Veils'") and now ...                See full summary »

44.name: The Wings of Eagles
44.description: A biography of Navy flier-turned-screenwriter Frank W. "Spig" Read.

45.name: The Spirit of St. Louis
45.description: Charles 'Slim' Lindbergh struggles to finance and design an airplane that will make his New York to Paris flight the first solo transatlantic crossing.

46.name: A King in New York
46.description: A recently-deposed European monarch seeks shelter in New York City, where he becomes an accidental television celebrity and is later wrongly accused of being a Communist.

47.name: Attack of the Crab Monsters
47.description: Scientists become trapped on a shrinking island with intelligent, murderous giant crabs.

48.name: Rock All Night
48.description: Cloud Nine, the local teen hangout, has been taken over by a pair of escaped killers, who hold the local teens hostage. The bartender realizes it's up to him to save the kids.

49.name: I Was a Teenage Werewolf
49.description: A hypnotherapist uses a temperamental teenager as guinea pig for a serum which transforms him into a vicious werewolf.

50.name: Silk Stockings
50.description: A musical remake of Ninotchka: After three bumbling Soviet agents fail in their mission to retrieve a straying Soviet composer from Paris, the beautiful, ultra-serious Ninotchka is sent to ...                See full summary »
